intro: Valeriana densa, commonly known as dense valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its dense, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters, usually pink or white, during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Valeriana densa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its sedative properties.
